headline: Community Partners Wanted For Baltimore‚Äôs Workforce Development Network
summary: Baltimore Mayor Brandon Scott is looking for community buy-in to build up the city's workforce development network.
bodytext: BALTIMORE (WJZ) ‚Äî  Baltimore Mayor Brandon Scott is looking for community buy-in to build up the city‚Äôs workforce development network. The mayor‚Äôs office announced plans Wednesday to expand its Community Job Hubs Network by inviting nonprofit organizations to join the effort. READ MORE:  Memorial Service Announced For Elijah Gorham At Mervo High School The network, an initiative of the Mayor‚Äôs Office of Employment Development (MOED), aims to help residents find gainful employment. Scott said his administration wants to build on the success of the Community Job Hubs Network, which has helped roughly 8,000 people find work since 2012. ‚ÄúBy expanding the Network, we will strengthen Baltimore‚Äôs economy ‚Äì delivering essential job training and employment services to residents and communities who need them most,‚Äù the mayor said. READ MORE:  President Joe Biden Addresses Several Issues During Thursday Night's Town Hall Organizations that join the network are assigned a trained employment specialist paid by the city who helps job seekers find work, prepare job applications and access support services. The current list of Community Job Hubs Network partners includes Bon Secours, GEDCO and My Brother‚Äôs Keeper. Unemployed residents who visit these organizations receive a wide range of assistance, from help with their resumes to referrals to occupational job skills training opportunities. ‚ÄúWe‚Äôre excited to partner with trusted organizations in our community to provide inclusive opportunities for jobs, training, and support services to residents throughout our city,‚Äù said Jason Perkins-Cole, MOED‚Äôs director. MORE NEWS:  Vaccinations For Younger Children Could Be Approved Next Month; The Latest On Outbreaks In Maryland Schools As 7 Children Hospitalized Organizations interested in joining the network are asked to request a partner site questionnaire from  CJH@oedworks.com  and return it by Oct. 29.

headline: Naked Woman At Denver Airport Walked Around Concourse Asking Passengers, ‚ÄòWhere Are You From?‚Äô
summary: A female passenger parading through a Denver International Airport concourse last month without any clothing drew attention from fellow passengers and airport police.
bodytext: DENVER (CBS4)  ‚Äì A female passenger parading through a Denver International Airport concourse last month without any clothing drew attention from fellow passengers and airport police. The woman, who had no luggage, appeared to be carrying some kind of a thermos, bottle or drink holder in her right hand. Beyond that, she was completely naked.   (credit: CBS)   READ MORE:  Memorial Service Announced For Elijah Gorham At Mervo High School ‚ÄúHow are you doing? Where are you from?‚Äù she asked bystanders who were videotaping her. In a minute-long video clip shared with CBS4, Denver police officers with a large blanket can be seen following the woman in an attempt to get her to cover up. She was smiling and laughing. ‚ÄúMa‚Äôam, ma‚Äôam,‚Äù police can be heard calling to the woman as they followed her. At one point she skips away from police who are attempting to wrap the blanket around her. READ MORE:  President Joe Biden Addresses Several Issues During Thursday Night's Town Hall   (credit: CBS)   The incident took place near Gate A-37 just before 5 a.m. on Sept. 19, according to Denver police. Typically, only ticketed passengers can get to the airport‚Äôs gates. In their report, airport police wrote they received a ‚ÄúReport of an intoxicated female completely nude. Officers.. responded and located the female running around the concourse having some type of medical issue. Paramedics were called code 10 (which indicates an emergency response) The female, was transported to University Hospital by ambulance due to an undetermined medical episode.‚Äù Denver police and airport authorities had no further information on the woman and the bizarre incident. MORE NEWS:  Vaccinations For Younger Children Could Be Approved Next Month; The Latest On Outbreaks In Maryland Schools As 7 Children Hospitalized Although CBS4 has obtained a copy of the video, the station is choosing not to broadcast it because authorities reported the woman was believed to be experiencing a medical issue.

keywords: office of the state fire marshal
headline: Edgewood Homeowner Lit Candle After Failing To Properly Disconnect Gas Range, Leading To Explosion, Fire Marshal Says
summary: An Edgewood man whose home was leveled in an explosion on Monday¬†failed to properly disconnect a gas range and then lit a candle, ultimately leading to the blast, the Office of the State Fire Marshal said Wednesday.
bodytext: EDGEWOOD, Md. (WJZ)  ‚Äî An Edgewood man whose home was  leveled in an explosion on Monday ¬†failed to properly disconnect a gas range and then lit a candle, ultimately leading to the blast, the Office of the State Fire Marshal said Wednesday. Investigators determined the owner of 2506 Thornberry Drive, Delbert L. Markley Jr., 67, tried to disconnect his gas range in anticipation of a new one being delivered on Monday. Afterward, he lit a candle. READ MORE:  Memorial Service Announced For Elijah Gorham At Mervo High School But the gas range was not properly disconnected, and the house filled with natural gas, the fire marshal‚Äôs office said. ‚ÄúNatural gas and propane are treated with a substance that has a distinctive odor that smells like rotten eggs. If you can smell it in your home, go outside and call 911 immediately,‚Äù State Fire Marshal Brian S. Geraci said. ‚ÄúDon‚Äôt smoke or use any electrical appliances, even a light switch or thermostat, because any spark could lead to an explosion.‚Äù Markley was in a rear bedroom during the initial explosion and suffered second- and third-degree burns and other injuries, the fire marshal‚Äôs office said. Following the explosion, Markley was able to pull himself from the debris and was helped by bystanders until first responders arrived, the fire marshal‚Äôs office said. Markley‚Äôs two dogs were in the house at the time of the explosion. One was rescued Monday night, but the other had to be euthanized Wednesday morning due to its injuries, the fire marshal‚Äôs office said. READ MORE:  President Joe Biden Addresses Several Issues During Thursday Night's Town Hall The explosion damaged adjacent homes. Neighbors  told WJZ  they heard a loud boom and felt their own houses shake. ‚ÄúI ran outside and in my backyard, you could actually hear all the debris falling, people screaming ‚Äòget out the house, get out of the house, get out of the house now!‚Äô‚Äù said Fred Farlow, who lives a street away. Henry Schwartzman, who lives next door, said the explosion knocked him off his sofa. He ran to get his wife. ‚ÄúI see smoke, flames and fire just shooting up so we got out right away,‚Äù he said. MORE NEWS:  Vaccinations For Younger Children Could Be Approved Next Month; The Latest On Outbreaks In Maryland Schools As 7 Children Hospitalized BGE officials said Monday that all of its own equipment showed no damage.

headline: Edgewood Man Accused Of Hitting Deputy With His Car, Pinning Him Against Another Vehicle
summary: An Edgewood man was arrested Wednesday after authorities say he struck a Harford County deputy with his car and then led deputies on a wild chase that ended with a crash.
bodytext: JOPPA, Md. (WJZ) ‚Äî  An Edgewood man was arrested Wednesday after authorities say he struck a Harford County deputy with his car and then led deputies on a wild chase that ended with a crash. Martin Bradley, 34, was booked into the Harford County Detention Facility on charges of attempted second-degree murder, first- and second-degree assault, assault on a law enforcement officer and reckless endangerment, among others. READ MORE:  Memorial Service Announced For Elijah Gorham At Mervo High School The charges stem from a series of incidents that began shortly before 7 p.m. Tuesday when deputies were called to an apartment complex on Eloise Lane in Edgewood in response to a fight, according to the Harford County Sheriff‚Äôs Office. There was no sign of the fight once deputies arrived, but while speaking with witnesses, they spotted a vehicle in the parking lot they believed was involved. Senior Deputy J. Amrein was approaching the vehicle when the driver accelerated toward him, hitting Amrein and pinning him briefly against another car, the Sheriff‚Äôs Office said. The driver sped away, leading deputies on a chase along Woodbridge Center Way and onto eastbound Route 40, where the vehicle crossed into the westbound lanes against the flow of traffic, deputies said. READ MORE:  President Joe Biden Addresses Several Issues During Thursday Night's Town Hall Deputies said the pursuit continued onto Edgewood Road, northbound Route 24 and Interstate 95 North before the driver got off at a rest stop and struck another vehicle. Senior Deputy Amrein was taken to an area hospital, where he was treated for minor injuries and released. The driver at the center of the pursuit, identified as Bradley, was treated for a possible overdose at the scene and airlifted to a hospital for treatment. He was discharged from the hospital Wednesday. Court records show Bradley remains in custody while awaiting a bail review hearing Thursday afternoon. MORE NEWS:  Vaccinations For Younger Children Could Be Approved Next Month; The Latest On Outbreaks In Maryland Schools As 7 Children Hospitalized A preliminary hearing in the case is scheduled for Nov. 10.

headline: Maryland High School Alumna To Take Blue Origin Flight To Space With William Shatner
summary: In a show of pride for their alumna, the Baltimore County school is holding a watch party of the launch.
bodytext: BALTIMORE (WJZ) ‚Äî  Aerospace company Blue Origin, founded by Amazon billionaire Jeff Bezos, is sending four people into a suborbital joyride Wednesday morning. Most notable among the passengers is William Shatner, best known for his role as Captain Kirk in ‚ÄúStar Trek.‚Äù At 90, he is set to be the oldest person ever to go to space. READ MORE:  Memorial Service Announced For Elijah Gorham At Mervo High School But there‚Äôs another prominent passenger boarding New Shepard NS-18, one with local ties. Audrey Powers is Blue Origin‚Äôs vice president of mission and flight operations. She is a 1994 graduate of Mount De Sales, a private, all-girls secondary school in Catonsville. READ MORE:  President Joe Biden Addresses Several Issues During Thursday Night's Town Hall According to Blue Origin‚Äôs website, she played a lead role in certifying New Shephard for human flight. In a show of pride for their alumna, the Baltimore County school is holding a watch party of the launch. Chris Boshuizen, a co-founder of satellite company¬† Planet Labs , and software executive Glen de Vries, are paying customers joining Shatner and Powers. headline: YouTube Star Zack Hample Catches 2 Home Run Balls During ALDS Game 4 At Fenway Park
summary: When Zack Hample settled into his seat for Game 4 of the ALDS between the Red Sox and Rays Monday night, he liked his chances of snagging a baseball.
bodytext: BOSTON (CBS) ‚Äì  When Zack Hample settled into his seat for Game 4 of the ALDS between the Red Sox & Rays Monday night, he liked his chances of snagging a baseball.¬†‚ÄúThese seats that I was in at Fenway last night ‚Äì dead center. So, I knew that lefties or righties could both hit balls there,‚Äù he told WBZ-TV in Boston. So, it was both a surprise and not a surprise at all when he caught not one, but two home run balls during the game. READ MORE:  Memorial Service Announced For Elijah Gorham At Mervo High School   Zack Hample (WBZ-TV)   ‚ÄúI have them right here. This is the one that Rafael Devers hit in the third inning, this is the one that Wander Franco hit,‚Äù said Hample. The New York City man has now caught 81 MLB home run balls during games over the years. The two from Monday night‚Äôs game are the first he‚Äôs caught in the postseason. READ MORE:  President Joe Biden Addresses Several Issues During Thursday Night's Town Hall He admits being in the right spot at the right time is an investment.¬†‚ÄúI‚Äôve spent more than $40,000 dollars this season traveling to different baseball stadiums. The tickets, the flights, the hotels, rental cars, tolls, parking, you name it. It really adds up,‚Äù said Hample. But it‚Äôs one that‚Äôs paid off, in the form of a  YouTube channel  with more than half a million subscribers. And of course, having a hand in some of baseball‚Äôs memorable moments.¬†‚ÄúThere‚Äôs been a lot of big ones. I snagged Alex Rodriguez‚Äôs 3000th career hit back in 2015. I caught Mike Trout‚Äôs first career home run in 2011 in Baltimore,‚Äù said Hample. He says he‚Äôs been to 99 MLB games this year alone and tells WBZ-TV Monday night aside, he‚Äôs struck out plenty of times. ‚ÄúOne thing that I try to think about when I‚Äôm picking a spot is will I have some room to maneuver left and right. Because the key to catching batted baseballs in a crowded stadium is, if possible, to have some lateral mobility,‚Äù said Hample. MORE NEWS:  Vaccinations For Younger Children Could Be Approved Next Month; The Latest On Outbreaks In Maryland Schools As 7 Children Hospitalized Hample says he‚Äôs currently debating whether he should end this season‚Äôs ballpark trips on a high note, or if he should come back to Fenway for one game during the ALCS.

headline: Maryland State Police Investigating Death Of Man Found In Susquehanna River Near Port Deposit
summary: Maryland State Police are investigating the death of a man who was found slumped over a log in the Susquehanna River near Port Deposit.
bodytext: PORT DEPOSIT, Md. (WJZ)  ‚Äî Maryland State Police are investigating the death of a man who was found slumped over a log in the Susquehanna River near Port Deposit. A kayaker found Rene Reyes Carranza, 48, of Street, Maryland, on Tuesday morning slumped over a log on the Cecil County side of the river, just off Route 222. READ MORE:  Memorial Service Announced For Elijah Gorham At Mervo High School Troopers made contact with the kayaker at 9:30 a.m. and saw Carranza‚Äôs body was partially in the water and slumped over the log, which was completely submerged near an embankment. Investigators found no signs of obvious trauma on Carranza‚Äôs body, and there was no indication of violence or foul play in the area where he was found, police said. READ MORE:  President Joe Biden Addresses Several Issues During Thursday Night's Town Hall His body was taken to the Office of the Chief Medical Examiner for any autopsy. Police are looking for Carranza‚Äôs vehicle, a 2006 black Honda Ridgeline with Maryland tags. MORE NEWS:  Vaccinations For Younger Children Could Be Approved Next Month; The Latest On Outbreaks In Maryland Schools As 7 Children Hospitalized Anyone with information on this incident is asked to call the Maryland State Police‚Äôs North East Barrack at 410-996-7800. Callers may remain anonymous.

headline: Police Offer $2,500 Reward For Tips In Columbia Double Shooting

bodytext: COLUMBIA, Md. (WJZ) ‚Äî  Howard County police are offering a $2,500 reward for tips leading to an arrest in Tuesday‚Äôs shooting in Columbia that sent two men to the hospital. The shooting was reported about 5:50 p.m. Tuesday at the Gramercy At Town Center apartment complex, not far from the Columbia Mall, according to the Howard County Police Department. READ MORE:  Memorial Service Announced For Elijah Gorham At Mervo High School Upon arrival, officers found 18-year-old Michael Lokougna suffering from multiple gunshot wounds. They found a wounded 22-year-old Aboudabar Diabate about a half-mile away. Both men were taken to University of Maryland Shock Trauma Center, where Diabate is listed in critical condition and Lokougna is listed in serious condition, police said. READ MORE:  President Joe Biden Addresses Several Issues During Thursday Night's Town Hall Guns were recovered from the areas where both men were found. It‚Äôs unclear if anyone else was involved in the shooting, according to police. Anyone with information about the case is asked to call 410-313-STOP. You can remain anonymous and you could be eligible for a reward of up to $2,500. headline: Giant Pumpkins Invade Annapolis For Fall Celebration
summary: City officials hope that once visitors get their photos in, they'll visit some of the countless restaurants and retailers in the sailing capital of the U.S.
bodytext: ANNAPOLIS, Md. (WJZ) ‚Äî  If you think corn mazes and standard pumpkin patches are too played out for fall pictures, visit Annapolis this month to say ‚Äúoh my gourd.‚Äù Four gigantic pumpkins have been strewn about downtown Annapolis and the city‚Äôs art district.¬†In addition to the monstrous pumpkins, there will be 300-pounders and baby pumpkins littering the highly trafficked areas. READ MORE:  Memorial Service Announced For Elijah Gorham At Mervo High School It‚Äôs all part of the city‚Äôs second annual Great Annapolis Pumpkins event. City officials hope that once visitors get their photos in, they‚Äôll visit some of the countless restaurants and retailers in the sailing capital of the U.S. ‚ÄúFall is a beautiful time of year in Annapolis. We wanted to do what we could to help spread the word that now is the perfect time to visit‚Äù said Kristen Pironis, Executive Director of Visit Annapolis. ‚ÄúBeing outdoors with family and friends, taking in the sights and sounds, and exploring the beauty of nature are what the season is all about. Add the magic of four 1,000+-pound pumpkins and you have a combination that‚Äôs hard to beat!‚Äù READ MORE:  President Joe Biden Addresses Several Issues During Thursday Night's Town Hall The city is also hosting a photo contest. Those who tag #GreatAnnapolisPumpkins on Instagram will be entered for a drawing to win gift cards for various spots in the city. Annapolis isn‚Äôt missing out on the chance to make the Pumpkins spooky. Ahead of Halloween weekend, local artists will carve the big pumpkins into jack-o-lanterns. The time to see the gigantic gourds is limited. After Halloween, the pumpkins will be composted along with other local pumpkins as part of Annapolis Green‚Äôs Great Pumpkin Drop-off. This year‚Äôs pumpkins will be turned into pumpkin spice compost. MORE NEWS:  Vaccinations For Younger Children Could Be Approved Next Month; The Latest On Outbreaks In Maryland Schools As 7 Children Hospitalized For more information on the event and prizes,  visit here.

headline: Baltimore County-Based Diamond Comic Distributors Acquires Collectible Grading Authority
summary: Diamond Comic Distributors, Inc., the Cockeysville-based distributor of comics, graphic novels and other pop culture ephemera, has acquired Collectible Grading Authority, a company that grades action figures, video games, collectible dolls and other items.
bodytext: COCKEYSVILLE, Md. (WJZ)  ‚Äî Diamond Comic Distributors, Inc., the Cockeysville-based distributor of comics, graphic novels and other pop culture ephemera, has acquired Collectible Grading Authority, a company that grades action figures, video games, collectible dolls and other items. Through its genre-specific subsidiary companies, Collectible Grading Authority encases collectible items submitted by customers and assigns a number grade based on their condition. READ MORE:  Memorial Service Announced For Elijah Gorham At Mervo High School Collectible Grading Authority joins Diamond Comic Distributors as one of several companies under the larger organization Geppi Family Enterprises. ‚ÄúI‚Äôm focused on expanding our product and service offerings to cement our position as the center of all things pop culture,‚Äù said Steve Geppi, president, chairman and CEO of Geppi Family Enterprises. ‚ÄúWe‚Äôve all been reading about the explosive growth in collectible grading, so getting into that business was a logical next step for us. As the undisputed leader in action figure and video game grading, CGA is the perfect addition to our portfolio.‚Äù During its two-decade existence, Collectible Grading Authority has graded almost 500,000 items for collectors, dealers, auction houses and other clients, Diamond Comic Distributors said in a press release. READ MORE:  President Joe Biden Addresses Several Issues During Thursday Night's Town Hall The company will continue to maintain operations in Atlanta, where it was founded. ‚ÄúWe‚Äôre not only excited to partner with Steve Geppi and the Geppi Family Enterprises portfolio of brands‚Äîwe‚Äôre also eager to accelerate our growth and take CGA to the next level as a result of our new partnership,‚Äù said Chad Thompson, CEO of Collectible Grading Authority. ‚ÄúThis is just the beginning of exciting new times as we look forward to continuing to serve our collecting communities for many years to come.‚Äù Wednesday‚Äôs announcement comes nearly two weeks after one of the industry‚Äôs largest publishers, Marvel Entertainment, officially switched from Diamond Comic Distributors to Penguin Random House to deliver new single-issue comic books, a deal that was  announced in March . After the partnership was made public, Geppi released  a statement  saying his company would still be able to carry Marvel products. MORE NEWS:  Vaccinations For Younger Children Could Be Approved Next Month; The Latest On Outbreaks In Maryland Schools As 7 Children Hospitalized In June 2020, DC, home to Batman, Superman and many others,  cut ties with Diamond .

headline: Few Answers Emerge After Rosedale Man & Son Found Shot To Death
summary: The search for answers continues after a Baltimore County man and his son were found shot to death Monday night inside their Rosedale home.
bodytext: ROSEDALE, Md. (WJZ) ‚Äî  The search for answers continues after a  Baltimore County man and his son were found shot to death  Monday night inside their Rosedale home. Officers answering a call about a shooting on Plainview Road about 9 p.m. Monday found 55-year-old Christopher Walker and his 24-year-old son, Justin, dead, according to the Baltimore County Police Department. READ MORE:  Memorial Service Announced For Elijah Gorham At Mervo High School Investigators have said the 911 call that night came from inside the residence, but additional details about the case have not been released. ‚ÄúAs far as who was inside the home and when they were inside the home, that‚Äôs all being investigated at this point by our detectives,‚Äù a police spokesperson said. The lack of answers and uncertainty surrounding the double shooting have neighbors puzzled about what might have happened. One neighbor who spoke with WJZ on the condition of anonymity said violence like the kind that occurred Monday night is uncommon for the area. ‚ÄúThey are calling it a double homicide, but we don‚Äôt know because they‚Äôre not releasing any of the information,‚Äù the neighbor said. ‚ÄúAnd it seems to be an isolated incident.‚Äù READ MORE:  President Joe Biden Addresses Several Issues During Thursday Night's Town Hall The neighbors willing to speak with news crews said they did not know the family because they didn‚Äôt live next door. ‚ÄúBy them being further down, we‚Äôve really had no interaction with that family or people at that end of the street,‚Äù a neighbor said. Sam Reyna, who lives in the area, called the double killing tragic. ‚ÄúI mean, a young father and young son, it‚Äôs not a good thing,‚Äù Reyna told WJZ. Police have not announced any arrests in the case, nor have they released any information about a potential motive. MORE NEWS:  Vaccinations For Younger Children Could Be Approved Next Month; The Latest On Outbreaks In Maryland Schools As 7 Children Hospitalized Anyone with information that could help investigators is asked to call 410-307-2020. Those who wish to remain anonymous can call Metro Crime Stoppers at 1-866-7LOCKUP.

headline: ‚ÄòIt Was Like Old Faithful‚Äô: Toilet Explosion Terrifies Family, Leaves Home Damaged
summary: "It startled [my husband] so bad that when he got up, he hit the dresser with his forehead, so he's got a nice little 'V' [cut]," Rita Sanders said.
bodytext: MINNEAPOLIS (WCCO-TV)  ‚Äî A central Minnesota family is left dealing with a plumbing nightmare after an explosion of water shot out from their toilet. Rita Sanders said the frightening incident felt like an earthquake, and is now left looking for help from her city. ‚ÄúIn an instant, it‚Äôs pressure, it‚Äôs noise,‚Äù Rita told WCCO-TV in Minneapolis. ‚ÄúIt was like Old Faithful.‚Äù READ MORE:  Memorial Service Announced For Elijah Gorham At Mervo High School The incident knocked a painting off its hanging, left Sanders‚Äô home with some water damage, and her sleeping husband ended up hurt.¬†‚ÄúIt startled him so bad that when he got up, he hit the dresser with his forehead, so he‚Äôs got a nice little ‚ÄòV‚Äô [cut],‚Äù Rita said. Outside at the time were Pine City Public Works employees, who Rita feels are responsible. She says this is the second time this has happened in the last few years.   (credit: CBS)   READ MORE:  President Joe Biden Addresses Several Issues During Thursday Night's Town Hall Neighbors didn‚Äôt experience the same unusual blast of water.¬†‚ÄúIt made me sad for them, because I know they had that trouble before,‚Äù said Pat Kempenich, who lives across the street. Scott Hildebrand, the city administrator, says the workers were jetting the sewer line, a way to clean it out using high-pressure water streams. Hildebrand said typically the work doesn‚Äôt affect individual homes.¬†He wishes Sanders would‚Äôve called immediately following the incident. She chose to send a letter instead in order to have communication about the problem in writing. Hildebrand said WCCO‚Äôs call was the first he heard of the incident, although Sanders says she spoke to someone in city offices who received her letter last week. MORE NEWS:  Vaccinations For Younger Children Could Be Approved Next Month; The Latest On Outbreaks In Maryland Schools As 7 Children Hospitalized The city is sending someone out to hopefully diagnose the problem early Wednesday morning.

headline: Maryland Man Pleads Guilty To Selling Heroin & Other Drugs Online
summary: A Maryland man faces five years in federal prison after pleading guilty to selling drugs online.
bodytext: BALTIMORE, Md. (WJZ) ‚Äî  A Maryland man faces five years in federal prison after pleading guilty to selling drugs online. Jason Lawrence Green, 40, of Salisbury entered a guilty plea Tuesday to a charge of possession with intent to distribute heroin, according to the U.S. Attorney‚Äôs Office for the District of Maryland. READ MORE:  Memorial Service Announced For Elijah Gorham At Mervo High School In entering that plea, Green acknowledged that he used a combination of his Salisbury apartment, a storage unit, and the U.S. Postal Service to sell heroin online from 2018 through October 2019. To keep a low profile, the 40-year-old used encrypted email providers and software that shielded his identity, location, and activity from prying eyes, according to federal prosecutors. READ MORE:  President Joe Biden Addresses Several Issues During Thursday Night's Town Hall Using a mix of surveillance, undercover investigation and tips provided by former customers, authorities eventually caught up with Green. A raid of his home recovered 77 grams of heroin, 41 grams of cocaine, 33 grams of amphetamine and other drugs. The search also found six firearms and nearly $14,000 in cash, among other items. MORE NEWS:  Vaccinations For Younger Children Could Be Approved Next Month; The Latest On Outbreaks In Maryland Schools As 7 Children Hospitalized Green has agreed to a five-year prison sentence as part of the plea deal, but ultimately it will be up to a judge to decide how much time he will serve.

headline: Groundwork Kitchen, A Restaurant Offering Free Culinary Training, Is Now Fully Operational With Dining Room Open
summary: It‚Äôs part restaurant, part culinary program. Groundwork Kitchen opened back in July offering takeout and delivery, but with the opening of their dining room, they are fully operational.
bodytext: BALTIMORE (WJZ)  ‚Äî It‚Äôs part restaurant, part culinary program.  Groundwork   Kitchen  opened back in July offering takeout and delivery, but with the opening of their dining room, they are fully operational. They‚Äôre also moving full steam ahead with their 12-week culinary arts program, a free program that provides students the knowledge needed to work in the foodservice and hospitality industry. READ MORE:  Memorial Service Announced For Elijah Gorham At Mervo High School Both the culinary program and restaurant is a social enterprise and expansion of the nonprofit Paul‚Äôs Place, which has been working to improve the quality of life in Southwest Baltimore for the past 38 years. Groundwork   Kitchen  fits that model perfectly, providing culinary training free of charge, and helping secure jobs for the students. ‚ÄúFrom the hotel industry, to quick service, to business casual, to upscale dining, the possibilities for careers in those different sections are endless,‚Äù said Executive Chef Kimberly Triplett. Each meal purchased from the restaurant, which is described as ‚ÄúMaryland style casual,‚Äù will help support the program. READ MORE:  President Joe Biden Addresses Several Issues During Thursday Night's Town Hall Triplett said the restaurant will provide the students a unique opportunity to learn from, and work with, industry professionals. ‚ÄúAnything to do with hospitality,‚Äù said Tripplet, ‚ÄúIt can be in front of the house, which they will be trained on, and back of the house as well.‚Äù It‚Äôs the chance to inspire and train future chefs while helping set them on a path to success. Triplett said, ‚ÄúIt‚Äôs an incredible experience to be a part of  Groundwork   Kitchen  and be impactful in helping individuals better their lives.‚Äù MORE NEWS:  Vaccinations For Younger Children Could Be Approved Next Month; The Latest On Outbreaks In Maryland Schools As 7 Children Hospitalized The proceeds from each meal support the culinary arts training program.

headline: Former Teacher, Student At Mount de Sales Academy Marvel At Alumna Audrey Powers‚Äô Journey To Space
summary: Former Mount de Sales Academy teacher Pat Bettridge watched in awe as one of the students she taught years ago, Audrey Powers, launched into space aboard Wednesday‚Äôs Blue Origin flight.
bodytext: CATONSVILLE, Md. (WJZ)  ‚Äî Former Mount de Sales Academy teacher Pat Bettridge watched in awe as one of the students she taught years ago launched into space aboard Wednesday‚Äôs Blue Origin flight. ‚ÄúShe did it and I am so happy for her,‚Äù said Bettridge. READ MORE:  Memorial Service Announced For Elijah Gorham At Mervo High School The company‚Äôs vice president of mission and flight operations, Audrey Powers, flew alongside the famous ‚ÄúStar Trek‚Äù actor William Shatner and two other crew members. Powers sat in Mrs. Bettridge‚Äôs English classes back in the early 1990s at the Catonsville school. And Bettridge said she remembers her very fondly. ‚ÄúShe was an outstanding intellect, as a student as an athlete,‚Äù she said. Powers spent 10 minutes in flight aboard the rocket called New Shepard. READ MORE:  President Joe Biden Addresses Several Issues During Thursday Night's Town Hall It was the second crewed mission for Blue Origin and powers played a big role in getting off the ground, which was a dream come true for her, said Bettridge. ‚ÄúI keep thinking back to when she was 13 and said I want to be an astronaut.‚Äù Many at Mount de Sales today also watched Powers blast off in the rocket during a launch watch party. A former classmate, Julie Gilless, was thrilled to see her finally achieve what she‚Äôd working so hard toward. ‚ÄúThis is so exciting,‚Äù she said. ‚ÄúNo one deserves it more.‚Äù MORE NEWS:  Vaccinations For Younger Children Could Be Approved Next Month; The Latest On Outbreaks In Maryland Schools As 7 Children Hospitalized Both Gilless and Mrs. Bettridge have been in touch with Powers and have been wishing her well.

headline: NFL Week 6 AFC North Preview: Steelers ‚ÄòGet To 3-3 By The Bye,‚Äô Says CBS Pittsburgh‚Äôs Bob Pompeani
summary: Still facing injury concerns, the Steelers host a Seahawks team that will be without Russell Wilson in Week 6.
bodytext: ( CBS Pittsburgh ) ‚Äî  The Baltimore Ravens lead the ultra-competitive AFC North, having won four straight. Aside from their Week 4 win over the Denver Broncos, every game has been decided in the final minutes with a margin of victory smaller than a touchdown. That includes Monday night‚Äôs overtime win against the Indianapolis Colts. The Cincinnati Bengals and Cleveland Browns are both coming off of close losses. The Bengals let a win over the Green Bay Packers slip through their fingers. The Browns couldn‚Äôt escape Los Angeles with a win, despite dropping 42 points on the Chargers. And then the Steelers continued to find their way, topping the Denver Broncos for their second win. READ MORE:  Bengals Visit Ravens With AFC North Lead On The Line CBS Pittsburgh sports anchor Bob Pompeani looks at the four AFC North matchups in Week 6. All times listed are Eastern. Stream your local NFL On CBS game live on Paramount+. Cincinnati Bengals @ Detroit Lions, Sunday, October 17 @ 1:00 p.m. The Bengals head to Detroit with a 3-2 record, though they probably should be tied with the Ravens atop the AFC North. Kicker Evan McPherson missed game-winning field goal attempts late in the fourth quarter and again in overtime. (Packers kicker Mason Crosby missed multiple attempts himself.) The bright side is that Joe Burrow once again put Cincinnati in a position to win. He threw for 281 yards and two touchdowns and two interceptions. The defense mostly held up against Aaron Rodgers, sacking him twice and knocking him down five times. They‚Äôll get an easier matchup in Week 6 against the winless Lions. Detroit just lost another heartbreaker on a last-second field goal, when Greg Joseph hit a 54-yarder with time expiring. They‚Äôre due for a win. ‚ÄúThey‚Äôve come oh so close to winning, and a couple of games that really should have won,‚Äù said Pompeani. ‚ÄúTucker‚Äôs 66-yard field goal, and then what happened last week actually got to a Dan Campbell, the head coach. He broke down in the media press conference afterwards. So both of these teams really need a win.‚Äù The Lions are desperate, which makes them dangerous for the Bengals. Jared Goff is capable under center. And Campbell‚Äôs emotion-filled interview may have inspired Detroit to play over its head. Their bad luck will eventually run out. Los Angeles Chargers @ Baltimore Ravens, Sunday, October 17 @ 1:00 p.m. The Chargers used to find ways to lose games. Now they‚Äôre finding ways to win them. Just witness the 47-42 shootout in Cleveland last week. That came two weeks after a 30-24 win over the Kansas City Chiefs. Justin Herbert is emerging as one of NFL‚Äôs best young quarterbacks. He torched a strong Browns defense for 398 yards and four touchdowns, giving him the most 300-yard games of any QB in their first two seasons. He has plenty of help on offense, of course, with game-changing talent at the receiver and running back spots. Mike Williams alone had eight catches for 165 yards and two touchdowns. The Chargers will face a Ravens teams that‚Äôs enjoyed its own fair share of success in close games. According to Pompeani, ‚Äúthis is the marquee matchup, especially after the Ravens won the way they did on Monday night. Just a brilliant performance by Lamar Jackson. Really one of the first times I‚Äôve seen a guy almost single-handedly carry a team to a win in that second half. But Justin Herbert‚Äôs done the same, a shootout with Cleveland last week.‚Äù READ MORE:  'Happy Halloween, Scooby-Doo!' On The Big Screen At M&T Bank Stadium Tonight Both teams come in 4-1, riding the strong play of their young quarterbacks. Jackson threw for an absurd 442 yards and four TDs on 37-43 passing. ‚ÄúTwo of the bright young stars,‚Äù Pompeani noted. ‚ÄúI think this is going to be a win for the Chargers. They typically lose games like this, going west to east. But they‚Äôve been winning a lot of games I didn‚Äôt expect them to. And I would expect them to win this game, because Baltimore has won a lot of games that I, quite frankly, thought they were going to lose. Arizona Cardinals @ Cleveland Browns, Sunday, October 17 @ 4:05 p.m. After a loss to the Chargers, the Browns look to bounce back against the Cardinals. However, Arizona, to date, is the NFL‚Äôs only undefeated team. They‚Äôve put up 30-plus points in four of their first five games, and Kyler Murray is playing at the top of his game. So far he has 1,512 yards passing, 10 TDs, and a rating of 113. But he‚Äôs also been sacked 10 times and taken a few hits along the way. ‚ÄúArizona has been walking the line,‚Äù Pompeani said. ‚ÄúThey‚Äôre undefeated. Sooner or later that‚Äôs going to end. And I think that Kyler Murray is going to be under a lot of pressure. This defense in Cleveland is for real. The ground game of the Browns is also for real. So I think they‚Äôll control the time of possession and win at home against Arizona. The Browns defense is allowing under 300 yards per game, one of only four NFL teams. They also have 16 sacks so far, tied for third best in the NFL. Myles Garrett accounts for seven of them. The two-headed beast that is the Browns run game includes Nick Chubb, who‚Äôs piled up 523 yards, and Kareem Hunt, who has 293 yards. Cleveland leads the NFL in rushing yards. The Cardinals don‚Äôt match up well with these strengths. Their run defense is one of the worst in the league, allowing 139 yards per game and 5.4 yards per carry. Seattle Seahawks @ Pittsburgh Steelers, Sunday, October 17 @ 8:20 p.m. The Seahawks find themselves in the unusual position of not having Russell Wilson under center. He had  surgery on his finger  and could miss six to eight weeks. That leaves Seattle in the hands of Geno Smith, who will lead them into Pittsburgh in Week 6. Smith went 10-17 for 131 yards and a touchdown after Wilson‚Äôs injury. He also threw an interception. ‚ÄúGeno Smith, one thing I‚Äôll say about him is that he has the same kind of game skills, which is to say he can do the things on the run,‚Äù according to Pompeani. ‚ÄúHe can break tackles. He uses his legs to buy some time. But this is going to be tough.‚Äù Smith will have to rely on an offense that‚Äôs been middle-of-the-road all season. The running game is averaging just 104 yards per game, while the passing game is good for 247 yards per game. The Steelers are facing their own injury issues with offensive implications. Ben Roethlisberger has been banged up much of the season. And receiver  JuJu Smith-Schuster  will miss the rest of the season with a shoulder injury. This could lead to more reliance on the ground game. Najee Harris ran for 122 yards against the Broncos, the first 100-yard game of his pro career. ‚ÄúI think the Steelers are going to find this run game to be something they‚Äôre going to lean on moving forward,‚Äù said Pompeani. ‚ÄúNajee Harris is going to get another 100 yards.‚Äù MORE NEWS:  Turgeon Still Hoping For Long Postseason Run At Maryland The Steelers also come in with a bit of extra motivation. ‚ÄúThe Steelers are playing at home,‚Äù Pompeani pointed out. ‚ÄúThey want to get to .500. They have a bye week after this. This is going to be alumni weekend, and all the Hall of Famers are going to get their rings. There‚Äôs going to be plenty of emotion.‚Äù

headline: Baltimore City Markets To Offer Short-Term Leasing At The Avenue Market In An Effort To Bring New Businesses To Pennsylvania Ave
summary: Officials announced a new partnership between Baltimore Public Market Corporation and Pennsylvania Ave Main Street to bring a six-month temporary leasing opportunity for new businesses interested in vendor stalls at the Avenue Market.
bodytext: BALTIMORE (WJZ) ‚Äî  Officials announced a new partnership between Baltimore Public Market Corporation and Pennsylvania Ave Main Street to bring a six-month temporary leasing opportunity for new businesses interested in vendor stalls at the Avenue Market. ‚ÄúWe are excited about partnering with local small businesses owners and entrepreneurs to bring vibrancy to the Avenue Market,‚Äù said Baltimore Public Markets President and CEO, Paul Ruppert. Pennsylvania Avenue Main Street Manager Nakeisha Turner added, ‚ÄúThe Avenue Market is the center of our Main Street program and we are looking forward to providing existing and emerging small businesses with the tools to grow and establish their brands in the community.‚Äù READ MORE:  Memorial Service Announced For Elijah Gorham At Mervo High School Officials said this is a temporary leasing opportunity looking to attract small businesses that may have interest in permanent placement once The Avenue Market has completed its redevelopment which is expected to begin in the summer of 2022. READ MORE:  President Joe Biden Addresses Several Issues During Thursday Night's Town Hall Tenants will have a lease term no longer than six months that begins on or after Nov. 1. There are opportunities for nine different locations with spaces of approximately 99-249 square feet. Applications will be accepted on a rolling basis at avenuemarketbaltimore.com. For any questions or concerns, please contact Nakeisha Turner with Pennsylvania Avenue Main Street at info@pa-mainstreet.com. headline: WHO Honors Henrietta Lacks, Baltimore Woman Whose Cells Served Science
summary: he HeLa cell line ‚Äî a name derived from the first two letters of Henrietta Lacks‚Äô first and last names ‚Äî was a scientific breakthrough.
bodytext: GENEVA (AP) ‚Äî  The chief of the World Health Organization on Wednesday honored the late Henrietta Lacks, an American woman whose cancer cells were taken without her knowledge during the 1950s and ended up providing the foundation for vast scientific breakthroughs, including research about the coronavirus. The recognition from WHO Director-General Tedros Adhanom Ghebreyesus came more than a decade after the publication of ‚ÄúThe Immortal Life of Henrietta Lacks,‚Äù Rebecca Skloot‚Äôs book about the discrimination in health care Black Americans faced, the life-saving innovations made possible by Lacks‚Äô cells and her family‚Äôs legal fight over their unauthorized use. READ MORE:  Memorial Service Announced For Elijah Gorham At Mervo High School ‚ÄúWhat happened to Henrietta was wrong,‚Äù Tedros said during a special ceremony at WHO Geneva headquarters before handing the Director-General‚Äôs Award for Henrietta Lacks to her 87-year-old son Lawrence Lacks as several of her other descendants looked on. Lacks died of cervical cancer on Oct. 4, 1951 at age 31. The tissue taken from her at Johns Hopkins Hospital in Baltimore provided the first human cells to be successfully cloned. Reproduced infinitely ever since, HeLa cells have become a cornerstone of modern medicine, including the development of the polio vaccine, genetic mapping and even COVID-19 vaccines. Tedros noted that Lacks lived at a time when racial discrimination was legal in the United States and that it remains widespread, even if no longer legal in most countries. READ MORE:  President Joe Biden Addresses Several Issues During Thursday Night's Town Hall ‚ÄúHenrietta Lacks was exploited. She is one of many women of color whose bodies have been misused by science,‚Äù he said. ‚ÄúShe placed her trust in the health system so she could receive treatment. But the system took something from her without her knowledge or consent.‚Äù ‚ÄúThe medical technologies that were developed from this injustice have been used to perpetuate further injustice because they have not been shared equitably around the world,‚Äù Tedros added. The HeLa cell line ‚Äî a name derived from the first two letters of Henrietta Lacks‚Äô first and last names ‚Äî was a scientific breakthrough. Tedros said the cells were ‚Äúfoundational‚Äù in the development of human papillomavirus (HPV) vaccines, which can eliminate the cancer that took her life. As of last year, WHO said, less than 25% of the world‚Äôs low-income countries and fewer than 30% of lower-middle-income countries had access to HPV vaccines through national immunization programs, compared to over 85% of high-income countries. MORE NEWS:  Vaccinations For Younger Children Could Be Approved Next Month; The Latest On Outbreaks In Maryland Schools As 7 Children Hospitalized (¬© Copyright 2021 The Associated Press. All Rights Reserved. This material may not be published, broadcast, rewritten or redistributed.)

headline: US Covid-19 Rates Are Declining, But Colder Weather Could Mean The Delta Wave Still Has Months To Go, Expert Says
summary: This Delta variant could be the last major surge of the Covid-19 pandemic, but now is not the time for the US to grow complacent as it has yet to run its course, an expert said.
bodytext: (CNN) ‚Äî  This Delta variant could be the last major surge of the Covid-19 pandemic, but now is not the time for the US to grow complacent as it has yet to run its course, an expert said. ‚ÄúWe still have a couple of months to go until this Delta wave sweeps across the country in a regionalized fashion and we are sort of done with it,‚Äù said Dr. Scott Gottlieb, the former director of the US Food and Drug Administration. READ MORE:  Memorial Service Announced For Elijah Gorham At Mervo High School ‚ÄúYou‚Äôre starting to see an uptick in cases in the colder parts of the country and, as people are driven indoors without masks on, you‚Äôll start to see cases pick up,‚Äù he said Monday. Nationally, the average daily rate of cases, hospitalizations and deaths from Covid-19 are on the decline. In the last week, the daily average number of infections has dropped by more than 15,000 to more than 86,000, and an average of 200 fewer people are dying per day, according to data from Johns Hopkins University. Still, an average of about 1,500 people died every day in the last week of Covid-19, according to JHU data. Much of the national improvement can be attributed to Southern states coming out of the worst of the variant surge, Gottlieb told CNN. But not all regions are faring so well. Numbers are ticking up in the West and Midwest, and it is still unclear how heavy the impact will be in the Northeast, he said. Gottlieb has predicted the worst of it will be over for much of the country around Thanksgiving and prevalence levels will decline around Christmas, but not all health officials are so certain. ‚ÄúI‚Äôm not sure that we can predict at this time that we‚Äôre not going to see a winter surge,‚Äù CNN medical analyst Dr. Leana Wen said. ‚ÄúI really think it‚Äôs too early for us to celebrate and say that the worst is behind us.‚Äù Before any celebration, the US needs to keep the trajectory of cases, hospitalizations and deaths going down, a feat which depends on vaccinating more people, Dr. Anthony Fauci said Monday. ‚ÄúWe have about 68 million people in this country who are eligible to be vaccinated who are not yet vaccinated,‚Äù said the director of the National Institute of Allergy and Infectious Diseases. ‚ÄúWe need the overwhelming proportion of those unvaccinated people to be vaccinated and then we can be quite confident that if we can do that, you will not see a resurgence.‚Äù ‚ÄúThis really depends upon us and our ability to rise to the occasion and get people vaccinated,‚Äù Fauci said. Vaccines are key to accelerating through the pandemic  Vaccines, in addition to other tools like testing, are what will help bring the Covid-19 pandemic into its endemic stage in the US, Gottlieb said Monday. When a virus becomes endemic, it poses a persistent risk of infection but is not causing large numbers of cases with severe disease and death. ‚ÄúThe reason why we‚Äôre going to get through this and the reason why we‚Äôre going to accelerate our way through this pandemic to an endemic phase with this virus is because of the vaccine,‚Äù he told CNN‚Äôs Chris Cuomo. ‚ÄúIf you look at past pandemics, they‚Äôve lasted upwards of five years. This pandemic probably won‚Äôt last that long for the West,‚Äù he said. Gottlieb said treatments and testing are also important, but vaccines are ‚Äúa key part‚Äù of fighting the pandemic. READ MORE:  President Joe Biden Addresses Several Issues During Thursday Night's Town Hall ‚ÄúThe fact that we could build a wall of immunity through vaccination, and not just mass-infecting the population, is going to be how we accelerate our way out of the pandemic into an endemic phase with this virus where we can hopefully keep it at bay,‚Äù Gottlieb said. Meanwhile, Pfizer and BioNTech said last week they are seeking an emergency use authorization for a vaccine for children as young as 5 years old. If approved, the increased accessibility will benefit the health of young children and the communities they occupy, experts said. ‚ÄúWe will really depend on kids, younger kids, getting vaccinated in order to increase the overall immune protection,‚Äù Wen said. The number of new Covid-19 cases in children remains ‚Äúexceptionally high,‚Äù according to new data from the American Academy of Pediatrics (AAP) published Monday. Children represented 24.8% of weekly reported Covid cases last week, when 148,222 cases were reported. More than 750,000 child cases have been added over the past four weeks, the AAP said. Cumulatively, more than six million total child cases have been reported since the start of the pandemic and children have made up 16.3% of all cases. Vaccine mandates work, Fauci says  As part of the drive to increase vaccinations, many health experts are calling for mandates in schools, workplaces and businesses. Fauci told CNN‚Äôs Wolf Blitzer the federal government is trying to persuade people to get vaccinated on their own, but some may need to be required to do so. ‚ÄúWe‚Äôve obviously been trying very hard,‚Äù Fauci said. ‚ÄúWe try to get trusted messengers out there and try and get this away from being an ideological or political statement, get back into the realm of pure public health, and try to convince people,‚Äù Fauci said. ‚ÄúI mean, we don‚Äôt like to be telling people what they need to do with regard to vaccines. But we know that mandates work.‚Äù But while many institutions have made the decision to mandate vaccines for their students, employees and clients, some states leaders are less inclined. On Monday, Texas Gov. Greg Abbott issued an executive order prohibiting any entities from requiring individuals to get vaccinated. ‚ÄúThe COVID-19 vaccine is safe, effective, and our best defense against the virus, but should remain voluntary and never forced,‚Äù said Abbott. MORE NEWS:  Vaccinations For Younger Children Could Be Approved Next Month; The Latest On Outbreaks In Maryland Schools As 7 Children Hospitalized The-CNN-Wire  ‚Ñ¢ & ¬© 2021 Cable News Network, Inc., a WarnerMedia Company. All rights reserved.
