headline: Ravens And Chargers Meet In Matchup Of Division Leaders
summary: The Ravens might very well be headed to another stressful fourth quarter, because up next for them Sunday is a clash with the Los Angeles Chargers.
bodytext: OWINGS MILLS, Md. (AP)  ‚Äî Baltimore coach John Harbaugh was asked recently to rank the pulsating finishes these past few weeks that have put his team atop the AFC North. ‚ÄúThe next one is going to be the best one,‚Äù Harbaugh said with a laugh. READ MORE:  Memorial Service Announced For Elijah Gorham At Mervo High School The Ravens might very well be headed to another stressful fourth quarter, because up next for them Sunday is a clash with the Los Angeles Chargers. This matchup pits two of the most exciting quarterbacks in the sport in Lamar Jackson and Justin Herbert. It‚Äôs also a game between teams that have been tested in close contests‚Äìand have come through often enough to lead their divisions. Baltimore (4-1) lost its first game of the season in overtime, then beat Kansas City with the help of a late fumble and edged Detroit on Justin Tucker‚Äôs 66-yard field goal. The Ravens rallied from a 19-point deficit Monday night to beat Indianapolis in overtime. Los Angeles (4-1) is coming off a 47-42 win over Cleveland in which Chargers trailed 3-0, 10-7, 27-13, 35-28 and 42-35. A couple weeks earlier, the Chargers beat the Chiefs on a last-minute touchdown. ‚ÄúIt shows us that we have the belief to win any type of game,‚Äù Los Angeles cornerback Chris Harris said. ‚ÄúAny type of way that teams want to play, we feel like we can play any style. If they want to pound and ground, we can play that type of game and still win a shootout. If it‚Äôs a close, tight-knit defensive game, we feel like we can win those games, too.‚Äù Herbert threw for 398 yards and four touchdowns against Cleveland. Jackson‚Äôs stat line against the Colts was similar: 442 yards passing and four TDs. Neither quarterback was intercepted. Jackson is passing more this year, and the Ravens lead the NFL in total offense. He‚Äôs still a running threat as well. ‚ÄúHe‚Äôs probably the most dynamic player in the NFL when he gets the ball in his hands,‚Äù Chargers linebacker Joey Bosa said. ‚ÄúAt the end of the day, that‚Äôs what we‚Äôre going to need to stop.‚Äù Harbaugh has plenty of admiration for Herbert as well. ‚ÄúHe throws the second-fastest football in the National Football League based on what I saw in the data. So, he has tremendous arm strength,‚Äù Harbaugh said. ‚ÄúI‚Äôve never seen him throw in person yet. This will be a first for me, personally. I‚Äôm looking forward to it. ‚ÄúKind of. Sort of. I guess.‚Äù EKELER‚ÄôS EMERGENCE Austin Ekeler is tied for the league lead with seven touchdowns and helped fuel the Chargers‚Äô rally last week against Cleveland with three touchdowns in the fourth quarter. ‚ÄúWhat you can do is activate him in the passing game and in the running game to give you an advantage depending on how people are playing you,‚Äù coach Brandon Staley said. ‚ÄúAgainst a rush that‚Äôs that good, you have to find your backs for some breathers back there when the pocket‚Äôs chaos.‚Äù READ MORE:  President Joe Biden Addresses Several Issues During Thursday Night's Town Hall Ekeler, who is fifth in the AFC with 349 yards rushing, hasn‚Äôt been stopped for negative yards or no gain in his last 37 carries. TOP TARGETS The Ravens lost receiver Sammy Watkins during the game against Indianapolis to a hamstring injury. That meant tight end Mark Andrews and receiver Marquise Brown were clearly the top options for Jackson to look for. Those two combined for 21 catches, 272 yards and all four Baltimore TDs. STOPPING THE RUN The Chargers come into Sunday‚Äôs game last in the league in run defense, giving up 157.6 yards per game. ‚ÄúWe have a high level of missed tackles with the yards after contact,‚Äù Harris said. ‚ÄúThat‚Äôs something we need to clean up.‚Äù The Ravens, who lost running backs J.K. Dobbins and Gus Edwards to injuries before the season, were held under 100 yards rushing by the Colts ‚Äî the first time in 44 games Baltimore failed to reach triple digits. KEEP AN EYE ON ‚Ä¶ Chargers kicker Tristan Vizcaino leads the league with four missed extra points, including two last week against Cleveland. ‚ÄúI feel like‚Äìwe feel like‚Äìthis guy‚Äôs a good player,‚Äù Staley said. ‚ÄúWe have to keep coaching him, stay patient with him. Because sometimes it‚Äôs what guys like this need, patience, and a little bit more experience.‚Äù The Ravens benefitted from mistakes by Indianapolis‚Äô kicking game Monday. The Colts missed an extra point, as well as a field goal that would have won the game. Baltimore also blocked a field goal. DAYLIGHT Baltimore returns to a more normal schedule now after playing three of its first five games at night. ‚ÄúWe‚Äôre really excited about it, actually, to get in that 1 o‚Äôclock rhythm,‚Äù defensive coordinator Don Martindale said. ‚ÄúI don‚Äôt know how you all felt on Tuesday, but I know how I felt. And Wednesday.‚Äù MORE NEWS:  Vaccinations For Younger Children Could Be Approved Next Month; The Latest On Outbreaks In Maryland Schools As 7 Children Hospitalized (¬©¬† Copyright ¬†2021 The Associated Press. All Rights Reserved. This material may not be published, broadcast, rewritten or redistributed.)

headline: Thoughtful Wedding Gifts For Every Budget, From $25 To $500
summary: Weddings are back. Here's how to shop for them, even if the couple doesn't have a gift registry or wish list.
bodytext: After a pandemic-induced lull on the wedding circuit, many couples are finally feeling safe enough to congregate with family and friends to celebrate their love. People in the business are calling it the ‚Äú wedding boom. ‚Äù The happy couple will walk away from the big day with many things: memories, a newly minted marriage and, traditionally, a haul of presents. But what does an out-of-practice wedding guest buy for brides and grooms in these unprecedented times? The couple‚Äôs wedding registry is often a good place to start: Many engaged people set up  online wish lists on sites like The Knot .   But what if your favorite prospective brides and grooms don‚Äôt have a registry, or haven‚Äôt made one yet? We‚Äôre here to help, no matter how much money you want to spend. Fortunately, many traditional wedding gifts are still very much in play in 2021. Housewares and kitchen upgrades are a perennial favorite. So are honeymoon- and travel-related items.   We cooked up a list of wedding gift ideas for any budget (and we mean¬† any  budget), so you can spend less time shopping and more time basking in the glow of all things love.   So, without further ado,  here comes the bride -approved wedding gifts.     Under $25: Patchwork monogram tea towel   For those couples who will soon share a surname, a monogrammed tea towel is a sweet and meaningful addition to kitchen decor. This line of embroidered towels is exclusive to Urban Outfitters.   Patchwork monogram tea towel, $12     Between $25 and $50: Picnic basket for two   Send your favorite happy couple on a picnic, the original al fresco dining experience. This two-person picnic basket comes with plates, utensils and an insulated compartment to keep drinks and perishables perfectly chilled. While promotions last, this picnic basket is marked down $4 from its list price on Amazon.   Picnic basket for two, $46     Between $50 and $75: Bloomscape‚Äôs Tough Stuff plant collection   This three-plant collection, from the houseplant purveyors at¬† Bloomscape , includes three low-maintenance starter plants: a snake plant, a ZZ plant and a hoya. Bloomscape orders have a 30-day guarantee: If the plants die within a month of their arrival, Bloomscape will replace them for free.   Bloomscape‚Äôs Tough Stuff collection, $69     Between $75 and $100: A pair of oversized Pendleton towels   Treat your newlyweds to a major towel upgrade. These oversized (40-by-70 inches) cotton velour towels are suitable for any occasion, from laying out on a sunny beach to bundling up after a dip in a hot tub.   Oversized Pendleton towels, $50     Between $100 and $150: SodaStream Terra Hydration Pack   SodaStream   Nothing says ‚ÄúI love you‚Äù like the gift of cold, carbonated beverages on demand. The Terra Hydration Pack comes with a sparkling water maker, one carbon dioxide cylinder, three dishwasher-safe, 1-liter bottles; two dishwasher-safe, half-liter bottles; and a small bottle of SodaStream‚Äôs Limebubly flavor drops.   SodaStream Terra Hydration Pack, $142     Between $150 and $200: Ulisse 28-inch spinner suitcase   This expandable, hard-sided suitcase will store everything a pair of lovebirds needs for a whirlwind travel adventure. At 28 inches tall, this large luggage option is too big to carry on, but it‚Äôs just the right size for packing clothing and other essentials for a honeymoon.   Ulisse 28-inch spinner suitcase, $179     Between $200 and $250: Coleman six-person WeatherMaster tent with screen room   For the outdoorsy couple, this roomy tent will accommodate up to six campers ‚Äî or, notably, some combination of campers and dogs. This tent also has an attached screen room, perfect for bug-free lounging. The tent is 6-foot-8 inches tall at the center, and the footprint measures 11 feet by 9 feet.   Coleman six-person WeatherMaster tent with screen room, $240¬†     Between $250 and $300: Delta Airlines travel gift card   If the couple you‚Äôre shopping for has been together for some time, they may not actually¬† need ¬†any new kitchen appliances. They probably could use a good vacation though. That‚Äôs where you come in. On¬† Giftcards.com , you can buy Delta Airlines gift cards and Southwest Airlines gift cards up to a $275 value. And with this thoughtful gift, your newlyweds can fund the honeymoon of their dreams. Just don‚Äôt be surprised when they bring you a souvenir.   Delta Airlines gift card   Southwest Airlines gift card     Between $300 and $500: 5-quart Le Creuset braiser pan   No wedding gift guide would be complete with this infinitely useful, easy-to-clean, all-purpose pan. And, it‚Äôs so pretty, it doubles as kitchen decor, adding a candy-colored pop to the stovetop.   5-quart Le Creuset braiser, $365     Gifts $500 and up: Gas outdoor pizza oven   We‚Äôve got three words for you: outdoor pizza oven. If you‚Äôre in the business of changing lives with your gifts, this one should do the trick. This oven reaches 950 degrees Fahrenheit in as little as 15 minutes. Pizzas cook in around 60 seconds.   Ooni Koda gas-powered outdoor pizza oven, $600     Related content from CBS Essentials     The ultimate guide to Black Friday 2021   Great smelling candles on Amazon to fill your home (and nose) with fall   7 stylish sofa beds that are actually comfortable   7 great coffee table options that look cool in any room   Super useful kitchen gadgets that make great gifts   These are the hottest toys of the 2021 holiday season, according to Amazon

headline: SportsLine Week 6 AFC West Picks: Chargers, Ravens Game To Feature ‚ÄòTwo Legitimate MVP Candidates,‚Äô Larry Hartstein Says
summary: Larry Hartstein discusses this week's slate of games in the AFC West.
bodytext: (CBS) ‚Äì¬† As we head into week 6 of the NFL season the AFC West is shaping up  exactly as everyone thought . The Kansas City Chiefs coming off back-to-back Super Bowl appearances are currently sitting at the bottom of the division at 2-3, with the Los Angeles Chargers riding high at 4-1. The Las Vegas Raiders and Denver Broncos sit in a two-way tie at 3-2. It‚Äôs been the Patrick Mahomes show since #15 took over the starting job in Kansas City, but second-year signal caller Justin Herbert is the one grabbing headlines this season, despite fairly similar stats. Mahomes comes into week 6 with 1,490 passing yards/16 touchdowns/6 picks while Herbert has racked up 1,576 passing yards/13 touchdowns/3 picks. READ MORE:  Bengals Visit Ravens With AFC North Lead On The Line The Raiders and Broncos square off this week with each looking to move two games above .500. Mahomes and the Chiefs will hit the road to take on the Washington Football Team, and the Bolts are headed for a heavyweight match up with the AFC North division-leading Baltimore Ravens. SportsLine ‚Äòs  Larry Hartstein  breaks down AFC West matchups in Week 6. All times listed are Eastern. Kansas City Chiefs @ Washington Football Team, Sunday, October 17, 1:00 p.m. Kansas City looks to rebound after an 18-point loss to the Buffalo Bills at Arrowhead last weekend. The Washington Football Team is also coming off a home loss, as they fell to the New Orleans Saints, 33-22. These two teams have had two common opponents so far, the Chargers and Bills, going a combined 0-4. If you put stock into this sort of thing, although the Chiefs‚Äô losses to Buffalo and Los Angeles were by a combined 20 points while Washington‚Äôs losses were by a combined 26 points, seemingly giving KC the edge in a head-to-head comparison. As for Larry Hartstein‚Äôs opinion heading into this one he says, ‚ÄúIt‚Äôs up to a touchdown now. The money has been coming in on the Chiefs, despite the fact that Patrick Mahomes has thrown six interceptions already, the last three games. This defense giving up 7.1 yards per play. That is historically bad. Last year the Lions and Jacksonville were the two worst defenses, only 6.3 yards per play; almost a full yard worse. Hopefully Chris Jones will be back to help that defense. But I just think the Chiefs aren‚Äôt as bad as they‚Äôve looked. Look at who they‚Äôve played ‚Äî Buffalo, Cleveland, the Chargers, the Ravens. Those are the four best teams in the AFC. So it‚Äôs been a gauntlet. When they did play an NFC East team, Philadelphia, we all remember what they did, winning 42 to 30. I think this is a similar spot where they don‚Äôt have to force things as much against this Washington defense, which is bad. I do expect the Chiefs to put up a big number and cover. But at a touchdown it‚Äôs not as great of a play as it was at six or six and a half.‚Äù Los Angeles Chargers @ Baltimore Ravens, Sunday, October 17, 1:00 p.m. READ MORE:  'Happy Halloween, Scooby-Doo!' On The Big Screen At M&T Bank Stadium Tonight This contest will feature two critically acclaimed QBs who are playing as good as anyone in the league right now. Lamar Jackson won the MVP in 2019, and he is on pace to have an even better season in a few key stats this year. Herbert is coming off a record-breaking ROY campaign and is also on pace to beat his award-winning numbers. Here‚Äôs what Hartstein has to say about this match-up between 4-1 division leaders. ‚ÄúThis is going to be a great game. If you follow me on SportsLine, I jumped on this early. Chargers plus three and a half. I didn‚Äôt think three and a half would last, and now it‚Äôs down to three. The Ravens had to go to overtime last week, and this is a short week for them coming off an emotional win. It‚Äôs going to be a great game, I feel this game is going to come down to the wire. You look at the Chargers, and they tend to play very close games. I like the value at three and a half. At three, I don‚Äôt love it as much. But I can‚Äôt wait to watch it, because you have two legitimate MVP candidates in Justin Herbert and Lamar Jackson.‚Äù Las Vegas Raiders @ Denver Broncos, Sunday, October 17, 4:25 p.m. For our final AFC West matchup, Hartstein is leaning towards the black and silver. ‚ÄúA lot of people are thinking that the Raiders will be in disarray because Jon Gruden was the play-caller and the offensive mind. I think last week they were distracted by the controversy, they were listless. They basically didn‚Äôt show up at home against the Bears. I cannot imagine them playing worse, now that that cloud is lifted. Rich Bisaccia, the interim coach, is very well respected. He has interviewed for some head-coaching jobs around the league, and I think the Raiders will be focused. This line has ticked up. The Broncos were at three, now they‚Äôre laying three and a half. I just think everyone‚Äôs expecting the Raiders to lie down and get steamrolled, but I don‚Äôt see it. I think this number feels about right.‚Äù MORE NEWS:  Turgeon Still Hoping For Long Postseason Run At Maryland So what NFL picks can you make with confidence? And which Super Bowl contender goes down hard?  Visit SportsLine to see which teams win and cover the spread, all from a proven computer model that has returned almost $7,900 since its inception , and find out.

headline: New Climate Models Show Much Of Southern California Underwater
summary: Climate Central, a nonprofit organization, released models showing startling images of landmarks around the world, including a few parts of Southern California like Long Beach and Huntington Beach, being impacted by rising sea levels.
bodytext: LOS ANGELES (CBSLA) ‚Äì  A climate centered nonprofit has shown in models how some 50 cities around the world could potentially change or even disappear as a result of climate change. ‚ÄúTheir ability to exist into the future depends on the actions we take,‚Äù said Benjamin Strauss, CEO of Climate Central. READ MORE:  Memorial Service Announced For Elijah Gorham At Mervo High School Strauss‚Äôs nonprofit Climate Central did the research and created startling images of landmarks around the world, including a few parts of Southern California like Long Beach and Huntington Beach, being impacted by rising sea levels. The Santa Monica Pier is a landmark seen from both the ground and the skies above, but these models show it could all disappear and, in 100 years, might look quite different. The model shows the Santa Monica Boardwalk underwater, projections climate scientists said could come true in the next few centuries if temperatures and sea levels rise without humans intervening. ‚ÄúIt‚Äôs really sad to think it could disappear one day beneath the rising sea,‚Äù Strauss said. The projections range from 1 to 4 degrees of warming, with the worst case scenarios showing seas rising by more than 20 feet.   Climate model visualization of Long Beach. (credit: Climate Central)   READ MORE:  President Joe Biden Addresses Several Issues During Thursday Night's Town Hall In pictures of Long Beach, high tides push in all the way to the 405 Freeway and much of Huntington is also underwater. ‚ÄúReally, neighborhoods from Golden West all the way out to Los Altos would be all well below sea level, could be 10 feet almost,‚Äù said Strauss. While images like these could be thousands of years into our future, scientists said climate change is already wreaking havoc along our coastline. ‚ÄúThis is not some thing that‚Äôs off into the future. This is happening right now,‚Äù said John Dorsey, a Loyola Marymount Professor. Dorsey studies rising sea levels and points out out losing our beaches and the tourists they bring could drain our local economy. He also said we‚Äôd lose infrastructure, like water lines, sewer lines and highways. ‚ÄúIF we get this coastal erosion that could erode in and start destroying that kind of infrastructure, we will be paying billions of dollars to try to move that inlands,‚Äù Dorsey said. Climate scientists say some of this could be avoided if we take major steps to cut emissions in the next decade. MORE NEWS:  Vaccinations For Younger Children Could Be Approved Next Month; The Latest On Outbreaks In Maryland Schools As 7 Children Hospitalized On Thursday, it was announced that President Biden will travel to Europe for the United Nations Annual Climate Change Conference in just a few weeks.

headline: Baltimore Police Make Arrests In Deadly Double Shooting
summary: Two men are under arrest in connection with a deadly double shooting in East Baltimore back in August, authorities said Friday.
bodytext: BALTIMORE, Md. (WJZ) ‚Äî  Two men are under arrest in connection with a deadly double shooting in East Baltimore back in August, authorities said Friday. Taijhae Brown, 19 and Kennard Johnson, 32, both of Baltimore, each face first-degree murder charges in the shooting that left 62-year-old Grace Jackson dead and a 52-year-old man wounded, according to the Baltimore Police Department. READ MORE:  Memorial Service Announced For Elijah Gorham At Mervo High School Officers investigating a ShotSpotter alert of gunfire in the 1700 block of North Patterson Park Avenue shortly before 7 a.m. Aug. 31 found Jackson and a man suffering from gunshot wounds, police said. READ MORE:  President Joe Biden Addresses Several Issues During Thursday Night's Town Hall Both shooting victims were taken to area hospitals. Jackson later died of her injuries. Court records show Brown has an arraignment hearing set for Nov. 1. MORE NEWS:  Vaccinations For Younger Children Could Be Approved Next Month; The Latest On Outbreaks In Maryland Schools As 7 Children Hospitalized A preliminary hearing for Johnson is scheduled for Nov. 9.

headline: Woman Brings Family‚Äôs Lost Dog To Animal Hospital ‚Äî But Doesn‚Äôt Return It To Owners
summary: Where is Wendy? She's the beloved pet of a family who has been searching for their missing dog who was last seen more than 10 days ago.
bodytext: CHICAGO (WBBM-TV) ‚Äî  Where is Wendy? She‚Äôs the beloved pet of a Chicago-area family who has been searching for their missing dog for more than 10 days now.¬†Wendy has since been spotted, but it‚Äôs who she was last seen with that has the family pleading for her safe return. Surveillance cameras at the VCA Arboretum View Animal Hospital¬†captured Wendy being carried off by someone on Sunday, October 3rd. They also captured that same woman walking out with Wendy, but neither have been seen since. It‚Äôs a sad twist of fate for her owner, Yesenia Aguayo, whose elation would soon turn to sadness. READ MORE:  Memorial Service Announced For Elijah Gorham At Mervo High School ‚ÄúWe usually take her outside in the backyard to go to the bathroom, and then she usually comes in,‚Äù Aguayo told WBBM-TV in Chicago. But¬†Wendy, an 11 year-old Shih-Tzu/Chihuahua mix, didn‚Äôt come back inside that fateful day, and likely wandered off. ‚ÄúWe made the report of a missing dog with the Bensenville Police Department, and I called the Bensenville Animal Hospital, and they said that nobody had turned her in,‚Äù she said. READ MORE:  President Joe Biden Addresses Several Issues During Thursday Night's Town Hall Hours later, another animal hospital called Aguayo; the VCA Arboretum View Animal Hospital located in Downers Grove, roughly 20 miles south of where Wendy went missing.¬†They told Aguayo someone brought the dog in as lost, and they scanned her chip. The person who found her, seen in surveillance video from the animal hospital, said she would willingly facilitate a reunion. ‚ÄúWe came to an agreement that we were going to meet up at the Speedway in Bensenville,‚Äù Aguayo said.¬†But the person who had Wendy never showed. Now, more than a week and a half later, Aguayo‚Äôs family is still searching for their beloved dog. She hopes someone recognizes Wendy, or the person who found her, and they can go back to feeding the small dog her favorite treat of warm tortillas.¬†‚ÄúPlease just drop her off at any police department, and my family and I will greatly appreciate it. She‚Äôs been part of the family for quite some time,‚Äù Aguayo said. MORE NEWS:  Vaccinations For Younger Children Could Be Approved Next Month; The Latest On Outbreaks In Maryland Schools As 7 Children Hospitalized WBBM-TV reached out to VCA to ask about their policy when someone brings in a lost dog.¬†They do scan for microchips and review any discrepancies. They are reviewing what happened in Wendy‚Äôs case, and are working with local authorities.

headline: How To Watch TV For Free With A Digital TV Antenna
summary: Try one of these digital TV antennas to watch TV for less
bodytext: Fewer than half of Americans still watch TV through cable and satellite,  according to a 2021 CBS News poll . But how are they still watching  NFL football games , live events and more without paying for cable or satellite monthly?   One answer is with a digital TV antenna. These affordable indoor antennas pull in over-the-air HDTV channels such as CBS, NBC, ABC, Fox and PBS for free. Indoor TV antennas make a great backup to watch TV if a storm knocks out your cable or satellite.   Before you invest in one of these useful gadgets, you should first know its limitations. Those who live in an area obscured by large apartment buildings or mountains, a digital TV antenna may not pick up a signal. Similarly, if you live too far from the TV signal source, a standard digital TV antenna won‚Äôt work ‚Äî you‚Äôll need an amplified digital TV antenna for that.   If you‚Äôre ready to get started, consider the digital TV antenna options ahead from  Walmart ¬†and  Best Buy .    RCA flat multi-directional HDTV antenna   Walmart   This antenna ¬†is¬† NextGen TV compatible ¬†for 4K ultra HDTV. It works up to 40 miles from a broadcast tower, and you can lay it flat, hang it or stand it up with its built-in easel stand.   RCA flat multi-directional HDTV antenna, $10     Camkey 2021 outdoor indoor digital TV antenna   Walmart   This antenna ¬†has up to a 200-mile reception range and is waterproof, so it can be used both indoors and outdoors.   Camkey 2021 outdoor/indoor digital TV antenna, $45 (reduced from $100)       Best Buy Essentials amplified ultra-thin film indoor HDTV antenna   Best Buy   This antenna ¬†has a range of up to 50 miles. It can be mounted on the wall or set on your TV stand. It has a two-sided black-and-white design, so you can choose which side blends in best with your wall or electronics.   Best Buy Essentials amplified ultra-thin indoor HDTV antenna, $30 (reduced from $35)     Clear TV indoor amplifying and broadcasting antenna   Walmart   Reviewers recommend¬† this uber-affordable antenna .   ‚ÄúI have an antenna on all my TVs and this one gets just as many channels as its more expensive sister,‚Äù reviewer Meg says. ‚ÄúI am thrilled.‚Äù   Clear TV indoor amplifying antenna, $13 (reduced from $15)     Core Innovations indoor TV antenna bar   Best Buy   This antenna bar ¬†allows you to access channels up to 80 miles away from a signal. It displays the current signal strength, helping you find the most ideal spot to place it.   Core Innovations indoor TV antenna bar, $80       Related content from CBS Essentials     Super useful kitchen gadgets that make great gifts   How to shop for a TV online in 2021: 5 things to consider   Miami Cuban links, pearl necklaces and more on-trend jewelry for men   Great sweatproof headphones and earbuds for the gym   11 top-rated face masks for exercising that actually let you breathe

headline: Good Samaritan Delivery Driver Helps Stabbing Victim ‚Äî Then Gets Struck With His Own Car By Thief
summary: ‚ÄúThe cop is standing next to me. I said, ‚ÄòThat guy's taking my car!' and then I ran over there ‚Ä¶ I was right in front of the car. He just floored it right into me and I literally rolled over the top, I fell off the back of my car,‚Äù Brandon Augst said.
bodytext: MINNEAPOLIS (WCCO)  ‚Äî A DoorDash delivery driver‚Äôs attempt to save a life wound up turning him into a crime victim himself. Brandon Augst has cuts and scabs on his legs, along with some gnarly road rash across his back.¬†‚ÄúIt hurts a lot,‚Äù said the 21-year-old from North Branch, Minnesota. READ MORE:  Memorial Service Announced For Elijah Gorham At Mervo High School They‚Äôre painful scars for a selfless young man still more worried about the person he was trying to help. Augst is a DoorDash driver who prefers to do his work in the Twin Cities. He was making a delivery Tuesday at about 11 p.m. near University Avenue and Victoria Street in St. Paul. Seconds before he arrived, police said two men got in a fight by the light rail station at the intersection. One got stabbed in the neck and was lying in the street.¬†‚ÄúHe was like rolling around and he put his hand up in the air,‚Äù said Augst, who then noticed blood around the victim. He pulled over, called 911, and ran over to help him.   Brandon Augst (credit: CBS)   ‚ÄúHe had like a huge hole probably about bigger than a quarter,‚Äù he said, adding that he was surprised other people didn‚Äôt immediately jump in to help. ‚ÄúNo one else was doing anything. Some guy was just sitting in his car right in front of [the victim].‚Äù READ MORE:  President Joe Biden Addresses Several Issues During Thursday Night's Town Hall Augst said police got to the scene quickly. He stayed on the phone with 911 as the officer and another bystander helped the victim. That‚Äôs when Augst noticed a man getting into his car, which he left running and unlocked. ‚ÄúThe cop is standing next to me. I said, ‚ÄòThat guy‚Äôs taking my car!‚Äô and then I ran over there ‚Ä¶ I was right in front of the car. He just floored it right into me and I literally rolled over the top, I fell off the back of my car,‚Äù he said. ‚ÄúEverything that I have except for my clothes was in my car.‚Äù Augst said the thief tried using his credit card at a gas station. He‚Äôs hopeful surveillance cameras captured him, adding that police plan to retrieve any video. The man who was stabbed will survive, which, besides getting back his car and belongings, was Augst‚Äôs biggest concern.¬†‚ÄúI didn‚Äôt think he would make it because he got stabbed right in the neck by the jugular,‚Äù he said. Augst‚Äôs car is a 2012 Toyota Yaris Hatchback. It‚Äôs light blue with the license plate MGR 991. The left rear door has a dent. Anyone who has seen the car is asked to call St. Paul Police. headline: FDA Advisory Panel Endorses Booster Doses Of Johnson & Johnson‚Äôs Single-Shot COVID-19 Vaccine
summary: A panel of U.S. health advisers endorsed booster doses of Johnson & Johnson‚Äôs single-shot COVID-19 vaccine Friday, saying they should be offered at least two months after immunization.
bodytext: WASHINGTON (AP)  ‚Äî A panel of U.S. health advisers endorsed booster doses of Johnson & Johnson‚Äôs single-shot COVID-19 vaccine Friday, saying they should be offered at least two months after immunization. J&J has asked the Food and Drug Administration for flexibility with its booster, arguing the extra dose adds important protection as early as two months after initial vaccination ‚Äî but that it might work better if people wait until six months later. READ MORE:  Memorial Service Announced For Elijah Gorham At Mervo High School The FDA‚Äôs advisory panel voted unanimously that a booster should be offered without setting a firm time. The advisers cited growing worry that recipients of J&J‚Äôs vaccination seem to be less protected than people who got two-dose Pfizer or Moderna options ‚Äî and that most got that single dose many months ago. The FDA isn‚Äôt bound by the vote but its ultimate decision could help expand the nation‚Äôs booster campaign. READ MORE:  President Joe Biden Addresses Several Issues During Thursday Night's Town Hall The government says all three U.S. vaccines continue to offer strong protection against hospitalization and death from COVID-19, and that the priority is getting first shots to the unvaccinated. But there‚Äôs a growing push to shore up protection against ‚Äúbreakthrough‚Äù infections and the extra-contagious delta variant of the coronavirus. Booster doses of Pfizer‚Äôs vaccine began last month for people at high risk of COVID-19, and the FDA advisory panel has recommended the same approach for Moderna recipients. headline: Hogan Announces $4M In Relief For Homeowners, Businesses Impacted By Ida Following FEMA Denial
summary: Gov. Larry Hogan on Friday released $4 million to provide money for home repairs, short-term rental assistance and business loans to homeowners and business owners who suffered damages from the remnants of Hurricane Ida in early September.
bodytext: ANNAPOLIS, Md. (WJZ)  ‚Äî Gov. Larry Hogan on Friday announced $4 million in relief homeowners and businesses who suffered damages from the remnants of Hurricane Ida in early September, one week after the Federal Emergency Management Agency denied a request for aid. The money can go toward home repairs, short-term rental assistance and business loans. READ MORE:  Memorial Service Announced For Elijah Gorham At Mervo High School Hogan also requested a disaster declaration from the federal Small Business Administration to unlock low-interest loans for impacted areas in Anne Arundel, Cecil, and Montgomery counties. The $4 million comes from the Maryland Department of Housing and Community Development and can be accessed through the Maryland Disaster Housing Assistance Program, the Maryland Disaster Relief Housing Program, and the Maryland Business Recovery Loan program. FEMA last week denied  the state‚Äôs request for aid to help the dozens of home and business owners impacted by the EF-2 tornado that hit parts of Anne Arundel County last month, saying the damage was not outside the capabilities of the state and local governments. READ MORE:  President Joe Biden Addresses Several Issues During Thursday Night's Town Hall ‚ÄúIn the absence of federal action, I am taking immediate steps to provide additional relief for the families and businesses affected by last month‚Äôs devastating storm,‚Äù said Hogan. ‚ÄúWorking with local leaders, we are going to continue to do everything we can to help the community get through this and recover.‚Äù Anne Arundel County Executive Steuart Pittman and Annapolis Mayor Gavin Buckley earlier this week lobbied Hogan to declare a local state of emergency so residents could gain access to relief through two state programs. In separate statements, Pittman and Buckley applauded Friday‚Äôs announcement. MORE NEWS:  Vaccinations For Younger Children Could Be Approved Next Month; The Latest On Outbreaks In Maryland Schools As 7 Children Hospitalized ‚ÄúThis is the good news we‚Äôve been waiting for,‚Äù said Buckley. ‚ÄúIt means the funding is being released and we couldn‚Äôt be more pleased to be facilitating this for our residents who need it after the terror of the September 1 tornado spawned by Tropical Storm Ida.‚Äù

headline: Columbia Community Collects Winter Coats For Afghan Refugees Settling In Maryland Area
summary: Elsie Joel-Morse says over the past two weeks, thanks to word of mouth and dozens of generous hearts, she's been able to gather close to 1,000 winter coats for Afghan refugees housed at the Quantico Marine Base in Virginia.
bodytext: COLUMBIA, Md. (WJZ) ‚Äî  A Columbia community is coming together to collect winter coats for Afghan refugees resettling in the DMV area. Elsie Joel-Morse says over the past two weeks, thanks to word of mouth and dozens of generous hearts, she‚Äôs been able to gather close to 1,000 winter coats for Afghan refugees housed at the Quantico Marine Base in Virginia. READ MORE:  Memorial Service Announced For Elijah Gorham At Mervo High School ‚ÄúThey get all these different emails, ‚Äòhey, we need this, we need that,‚Äô whether it‚Äôs diapers or strollers. And then we got an email saying, ‚Äòhey, we need coats.‚Äô It‚Äôs not cold back home,‚Äù said Joel-Morse. Maryland ranks fourth in the nation for SIV or special immigrant visa arrivals and welcomed about 200 refugees in August, according to Gov. Larry Hogan who announced his commitment to receive Afghan refugees as US forces withdrew from Afghanistan and the Taliban regained control. READ MORE:  President Joe Biden Addresses Several Issues During Thursday Night's Town Hall ‚ÄúNow, with the launch of Welcome.US, all of us can help by donating to frontline organizations, offering to serve as a host family and by providing essential services,‚Äù said Hogan. As many Afghani families begin to resettle and rebuild their lives in the US, helping hands from their local communities like this one are a crucial asset. ‚ÄúIt‚Äôs amazing to see people in the community really want to help and seeing the love and support is pretty amazing,‚Äù said Joel-Morse. headline: MD Court Of Special Appeals Rules Mosby‚Äôs ‚ÄòDo-Not-Call‚Äô List Is Not Exempt From Public Records Laws
summary: Baltimore City State's Attorney Marilyn Mosby's "do-not-call" list of 305 police officers with "integrity issues" is not exempt from public records laws, the Maryland Court of Special Appeals ruled on Thursday.
bodytext: ANNAPOLIS, Md. (WJZ)  ‚Äî Baltimore City State‚Äôs Attorney Marilyn Mosby‚Äôs ‚Äúdo-not-call‚Äù list of 305 police officers with ‚Äúintegrity issues‚Äù is not exempt from public records laws, the Maryland Court of Special Appeals ruled on Thursday. The three-judge panel determined the document could not be classified as a personnel record which might be exempt from public records requests because the Baltimore City State‚Äôs Attorney‚Äôs Office does not have the ability to hire, fire or directly discipline Baltimore City Police officers. READ MORE:  Memorial Service Announced For Elijah Gorham At Mervo High School The court also ruled the list does not get an exemption for ‚Äúattorney work-product,‚Äù because such documents are prepared for a specific trial. Additionally, the court found Mosby‚Äôs office‚Äôs refusal to waive $18,000 in fees to for two public records requests was ‚Äúarbitrary and capricious.‚Äù Following news of the ruling, Mosby released a statement saying she planned to release the list ‚Äúin short order,‚Äù but did not specify a timeline. ‚ÄúWe were told by the Attorney General‚Äôs Office earlier this year that we were legally prohibited from releasing our Do Not Call list,‚Äù she said. ‚ÄúI have always been clear about my desire to release this list, and this ruling and the recent MPIA law change, which I advocated for, gives us the authority to release the list.‚Äù A representative from Attorney General Brian Frosh‚Äôs office challenged that characterization, saying Mosby could have released the list at any point and chose not to. ‚ÄúIt was the State‚Äôs Attorney‚Äôs Office‚Äôs decision initially to withhold the information,‚Äù said spokesperson Raquel Coombs. ‚ÄúSubsequently, our office offered legal advice that the State‚Äôs Attorney‚Äôs Office was within its rights to do so.‚Äù READ MORE:  President Joe Biden Addresses Several Issues During Thursday Night's Town Hall Mosby first disclosed  there were 305 Baltimore police officers  on the ‚Äúdo-not-call list‚Äù in December 2019 during testimony before the Maryland Commission To Restore Trust In Policing, a state group tasked with investigating the the Baltimore Police Department‚Äôs¬† Gun Trace Task Force . Officers on the list are not necessarily excluded from testifying, Mosby said, but her office would ‚Äúprovide automatic disclosure‚Äù to defense attorneys when these officers are involved in cases. A smaller number of officers on the list are excluded from providing testimony, she said. Baltimore Action Legal Team, a nonprofit group of activist lawyers, filed a Maryland Public Information Act request for the ‚Äúnames, ranks, badge numbers, job assignments, and dates of hire of the individual officers‚Äù on the list on Dec. 6, 2019, according to appeals court ruling. In January 2020, Mosby‚Äôs office denied the request, saying it met the ‚Äúpersonnel record‚Äù exemption. Baltimore Action Legal Team filed subsequent public records requests for investigations into the criminal conduct of police officers during the 2019 calendar year and any cases that had been open for more than 16 months, and for the files on any ‚Äúdirected at potential  or alleged criminal conduct‚Äù of one particular officer. Mosby‚Äôs office said it would cost $15,000 for attorneys and clerks to assemble the records to process the first request, and an additional $3,000 for the second. Baltimore Action Legal Team asked for the fees to be waived, citing the public interest in the information, but did not receive a response. MORE NEWS:  Vaccinations For Younger Children Could Be Approved Next Month; The Latest On Outbreaks In Maryland Schools As 7 Children Hospitalized The nonprofit and another group demanding police transparency, Open Justice Baltimore, sued in March 2020. A Baltimore City Circuit Court judge ruled the list could not be released and the State‚Äôs Attorney‚Äôs Office was allowed to waive the fees because Baltimore Action Legal Team did not provide evidence it couldn‚Äôt afford to pay them.

headline: Ravens CB Marlon Humphrey To Speak At Graduation Ceremony For People Who Completed Drug Treatment
summary: Ravens cornerback Marlon Humphrey is scheduled to speak at a graduation ceremony next week for people who completed drug treatment through the state court system, the Maryland Judiciary announced Friday.
bodytext: BALTIMORE (WJZ)  ‚Äî Ravens cornerback Marlon Humphrey is scheduled to speak at a graduation ceremony next week for people who completed drug treatment through the Baltimore City court system, the Maryland Judiciary announced Friday. Founded in 1994, Adult Drug Treatment Court has provided comprehensive treatment for hundreds of nonviolent offenders battling alcoholism and other substance use problems, with the goal of monitoring a defendant‚Äôs progress and breaking ‚Äúthe cycle of recidivism,‚Äù the judiciary said. headline: Suspect In Custody After Odenton Woman, 23, Struck By Stray Gunfire
summary: A 23-year-old Odenton woman called 911 on Friday to report she was struck by stray gunfire while sitting inside her apartment, authorities said.
bodytext: ODENTON, Md. (WJZ) ‚Äî¬† A 23-year-old Odenton woman called 911 Friday to report she was struck by stray gunfire while sitting inside her apartment, authorities said. The shooting happened about 12:45 p.m. in the 700 block of Hammond Branch Road, less than a half-mile away from Piney Orchard Elementary School, according to Anne Arundel County Police. READ MORE:  Memorial Service Announced For Elijah Gorham At Mervo High School Upon arrival, officers found the victim, who was taken to an area hospital with an injury to an extremity that was not considered life-threatening. They also found several rifle shell casings outside an apartment building at the scene. Witnesses told police the shooting occurred after a dispute broke out between two individuals. One of them, witnesses said, opened fire with a rifle and fled in an Audi. READ MORE:  President Joe Biden Addresses Several Issues During Thursday Night's Town Hall Investigators later found the Audi and detained the people inside, according to police. A loaded AR-15 rifle and handgun were recovered from the vehicle. Police said they took a suspect into custody, but noted that charges have not yet been filed. Anyone with information about the case is asked call police at 410-222-6155 or the anonymous tip line at 410-222-4700.   A suspect is in custody. One victim sustained an apparent non-life-threatening injury to an extremity.  There is no ongoing threat to the community.  Scene remains active ‚Ä¶ please follow police direction.  https://t.co/kg5P7eUF3v   ‚Äî Anne Arundel Police (@AACOPD)  October 15, 2021 MORE NEWS:  Vaccinations For Younger Children Could Be Approved Next Month; The Latest On Outbreaks In Maryland Schools As 7 Children Hospitalized ¬†

headline: MS-13 Gang Leader Gets 45 Years In Racketeering Conspiracy To Commit Murders, Extortion
summary: Jorge Guerra-Castillo, 40, of Silver Spring, was sentenced to 45 years in federal prison, followed by five years of supervised release for pleading guilty in July to conspiracy to participate in racketeering activities, including two murders and two attempted murders, according to a statement from the Maryland District of the U.S. Attorney's Office.
bodytext: BALTIMORE (WJZ) ‚Äî ¬†Jorge Guerra-Castillo, 40, of Silver Spring, was sentenced to 45 years in federal prison, followed by five years of supervised release for pleading guilty in July to conspiracy to participate in racketeering activities, including two murders and two attempted murders, according to a statement from the Maryland District of the U.S. Attorney‚Äôs Office. Guerra-Castillo was a member of the Fulton Locos Salvatruchas clique in MS-13 who approved and arranged for gang members to kill a man on April 7, 2015, by luring him to a wooded area in Frederick, where they struck him with a machete until he died, according to the statement. The MS-13 members buried the victim‚Äôs body in that area. READ MORE:  Memorial Service Announced For Elijah Gorham At Mervo High School Before May 10, 2015, Guerra-Castillo forced the second victim to make regular extortion payments to the gang. He then directed gang members to kidnap and kill the man on May 10, 2015, when he stopped making the payments, according to the statement. Gang members forced the man into a vehicle, took him to a wooded area, and were about to kill him but didn‚Äôt when the man agreed to pay. The man was then released. READ MORE:  President Joe Biden Addresses Several Issues During Thursday Night's Town Hall Guerra-Castillo approved gang members killing a third man on Aug. 28, 2015, after surveilling him and his girlfriend. They went to his apartment that day, waited for the couple to return, and attacked them with a machete and knives, according to the statement. They both survived, but the man suffered severe wounds to his face and both hands were nearly severed. He lost all function in one hand and has only limited use of the other. In the final incident to which Guerra-Castillo pleaded guilty, he admitted to approving and assisting in planning a murder of a rival gang member. On June 24, 2017, Guerra-Castillo‚Äôs girlfriend lured the victim to a location so other gang members could kidnap and kill him. They took him to a secluded area in Crownsville, where a grave had been dug already. They attacked the man with a machete and knives until he died, then dismembered the man and buried him in the grave, according to the statement. This murder was to maintain and increase both the status of MS-13 and the gang‚Äôs members. MORE NEWS:  Vaccinations For Younger Children Could Be Approved Next Month; The Latest On Outbreaks In Maryland Schools As 7 Children Hospitalized ¬†

headline: Brazen Thieves Targeting ATMs In Baltimore City & Baltimore County, Police Say
summary: Police in Baltimore City and Baltimore County are searching for some brazen thieves targeting ATMs overnight.
bodytext: WOODLAWN, Md. (WJZ) ‚Äî  Police in Baltimore City and Baltimore County are searching for some brazen thieves targeting ATMs overnight. The latest attempt was at Security Square Mall. Video shows a car driving through the doors of the main entrance at Security Square Mall. The suspect(s) can be seen ramming their car into at atm near the food court. READ MORE:  Memorial Service Announced For Elijah Gorham At Mervo High School ‚ÄúAt least one suspect exited the vehicle and attempted to steal the atm that suspect‚Äôs attempts were unsuccessful and they did flee the scene,‚Äù said John Connor, detective, Baltimore County Police Department. It‚Äôs the latest in a slew of robberies in Baltimore City and County, four in the past week alone. On Wednesday, there were two in one night including a business off Deaver Dam Road in Cockeysville. The suspects took off with an ATM there. ‚ÄúIt‚Äôs still under investigation whether these two are related,‚Äù said Connor. In Baltimore City, suspects drove a van into a Gold‚Äôs Financial Services busting down the wall but then fleeing on foot, empty-handed. READ MORE:  President Joe Biden Addresses Several Issues During Thursday Night's Town Hall ‚ÄúAnd one of the young lady‚Äôs working here said ‚Äòmiss betty they tried to get in here‚Äô I said what?‚Äù said Betty Arnold. Betty Arnold has been going to Gold‚Äôs every day for 10 years to buy her lottery ticket. She can‚Äôt imagine this happening here. ‚ÄúThey backed the truck up and the truck got stuck and they couldn‚Äôt get any further,‚Äù said Arnold. And back in the County, last Saturday night, a suspect used their car to try and take an ATM at a Walgreens off Harford Road. ‚ÄúWe are up to seven for the year 2021. Last year, throughout all of 2020 we had 37 ATM-related thefts Baltimore County Police say this is a time for business owners who may have an ATM in their store to be alert. MORE NEWS:  Vaccinations For Younger Children Could Be Approved Next Month; The Latest On Outbreaks In Maryland Schools As 7 Children Hospitalized County Police have a free security survey service where officers will come out and assess any potential weaknesses that may exist around the ATM.
